Tunza Trust Fund

Tunza Trust Fund is a special project of Tunza Afr!ka. The Trust Fund was established in June 2020 to respond creatively to the COVID-19 pandemic. It is a long-term initiative intended to support leadership and innovation in villages, informal settlements and other spaces where the spirit of resilience and creativity is most evident in various parts of Kenya.

The Tunza Trust Fund support individuals, agencies and communities to enhance their creativity and innovation in challenging environments. The Trust Fund is led by individuals who strongly believe that the emergency response to COVID-19 needs to be accompanied by a robust long term program to enable individual and communities “get back to their feet” and thrive.

    Objectives

    The Tunza Trust Fund is guided by the following objectives:

  1. Provide assistance, technical support and accompaniment to innovative projects.
  2. Act as a resource for conversations, reflections and development of ideas, particularly those that empower people economically.
  3. Create space for, and provide support to, community-oriented micro-enterprise initiatives.
  4. Provide support to individuals and families in extreme need during unforeseen challenges like COVID-19 and other emergencies.

Contributions

Contributions to the Tunza Trust Fund are made from individuals, agencies, organizations and private institutions.
